page.title: 08The Lewes Ten
page.content: that it was flat for about half a mile before the steep climb to Black Cap.The track was full of loose flints.From Black Cap we rejoined the course about 5 miles from the finish. We went down a steep hill.At the bottom were very big chunks of mud.We went along the edge of a corn field, through two gates and up a steep hill. After that we went through a field and back along the track from Black Cap to the finish. At the start the the runners had to line up according to their estimated times of finishing.Refreshments and changing facilaties were at our school,the Wallands. There was a seperate race for under 16 boys and girls.It started 5 minutes after the Lewes Ten and was run over a 3 mile course.Over 50 children took part,including some from our school.
